course.subject: HUMA
course.name: Anthropology of Food
course.description: This course examines the basic structures and changes of human cultures and societies through the survey of food customs in different socio-cultural contexts. From the perspective of cultural anthropology, the connections between food system and other socio-cultural institutions and their integration into the global system will be explored.

reviews.author: M_1240
reviews.title: Unclear structure and heavy workload
reviews.comment_content:
The content is fairly interesting if you like to read.

The topics focus on the symbolism of food, food in social scenarios and rituals.

They are all presented in the form of readings (roughly 15-30 pages). There are separate readings for class and tutorials.

The content was unclear and the TA was unresponsive to my emails, so I was left to google most things.
reviews.comment_teaching:
While he is very passionate about anthropology, he teaching is very slow and unclear.

He will provide paper copies of the slides but his slides mainly contain pictures.

He doesn't usually reference the readings in class, so you are left to read them on your own.

He rarely uses canvas for grading, so be ready to submit projects through email and praying he got it.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is confusing.

There are a lot of opportunities to earn extra points, for example, going on field trips and writing a report on it or by making a presentation for your project.

I scored above mean in both quizzes, missed two tutorials and did not earn any extra points. He also seemed to have a lot of problems with my project topic. I ended up with B+
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is fairly heavy.

Project (individual or groups of 2)
You will have to write a report on any anthropological topic of your choice. It has to be 3000 words and you will have to conduct fieldwork.

There are two quizzes during the sem based on readings. YOU WILL HAVE TO READ 7-10 READINGS FOR EACH QUIZ.

Tutorials are compulsory and there will be attendance taken. Participation is tutorials is also necessary. Groups of 4 will be formed in tutorials and you will have to present any 1 tutorial reading.

You lose points for missing tutorials.

reviews.author: msdaydream
reviews.title: Very heavy workload:(
reviews.comment_content:
More of a Chinese culture course than a food course
Quite interesting in general
reviews.comment_teaching:
Inspiring
TA is helpful when it comes to explaining concepts
Teaching unrelated to things tested in midterms though he tries to explain some keyterms
reviews.comment_grading:
Average grading
Easy to get 1 SD above mean for midterm 1 ks people tend to underestimate it
The class gets competitive for midterm 2
reviews.comment_workload:
Heavy
2 midterms which require a lot of readings, on average 9 readings per midterm
In addition, the professor will provide students with a list of 25 anthropology related terms where you have to find their definitions and examples from the readings
A final project which forbids students to use secondary data and only field research data
Attendance counted so just try to be present every lecture
Tutorials which require students to participate in discussion questions by raising hands
Everyone have to present a reading which lasts for 20 minutes
Choose groupmates wisely
You can earn bonus points by going to field trips and doing presentations (relatively easy to earn points)
